column5: went to go get 2 new 10lb balls. lol forget that 50 bucks a pop . i'm gonna drill some rocks  anyone know where to look? i just installed my new walker tournament riggers and i was hoping on getting out tonight/    any idea what the waves will be like tonight?> i checked this out http://www.theweathernetwork.com/marine/WWMA002112 but i'm not really sure what it means
Depending on where you live, check out Kijiji, this was a add I found in 3 seconds of searching the site for Toronto Area.  Cannon Downrigger Flash Ball #6

You need to look around.Prices vary.You really should have a minimum of a 10lb ball. Any lighter and the ball will  not be almost straight beside the boat. Average price on a 10lb ball is around 20.00-35.00.You mus have been at CTC at 50.00.  Here is what I see for weather and it depends where  you are located on the lake.
the dude at fishing world said likw 49.99 for a 10lb ball  i was like WAT

Don't know about the rigger stuff, but here's a much better site for wind conditions.  http://www.sailflow.com/windandwhere.iws?r...mp;timeOffset=0  The wind is measured in knots...so to calculate into kph, multiply knots by 1.852.  10 knots = 18.52 km/h.  The link you pasted does give wave heights...in meters.
You should have been here last year, I gave two of them away LOL. I have about 150 lbs of lead if you want to make a mold and cast some?
i'll make the Mold at work and we split the profit on your 150lbs of lead LOL jokes they are really easy to make though surprised they are so much to buy
lol rhx guys ...i dont kow how to cast em
I have 2 Brand new 12lbers I will let you have them for 50.00 for the pair.
Probably have an environmental fee stuck in the price because they're lead. Kerry
